analysis.Summary: This file defines the front–end route configuration for the “members” section of the organizations module in a Martyrs/Vue.js application. It exports an array of route objects, each mapping a URL path to a lazy-loaded Vue component.
analysis.Purpose: Provide centralized route definitions for listing organization members and inviting new members, so they can be registered in the app’s main router.

Components.responsibility: Displays the list of organization members.
Shows the UI for inviting or adding a new member to the organization.

Functions.name: default export (membersRoutes)
Functions.description: An array of route-definition objects used by Vue Router to register the members and invite-members pages.

Functions.name: component (arrow function)
Functions.description: A dynamic import function that lazy-loads the specified Vue component when the route is visited.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the module’s main router index (e.g. modules/organizations/router/index.js) and spread into the global Vue Router configuration so that these routes become active in the application.
analysis.Notes: 1) Uses dynamic imports for code-splitting and on-demand component loading. 2) Meta title is internationalized (en/ru) for the members listing page. 3) No authentication or guard logic is defined here; such logic would be applied at a higher routing layer if needed.
